english: to send out; to emit; to issue; to develop

etymology.description: Originally a pictogram of a bow shooting an arrow; later + hand 攴 forming 㢭; the hand evolved into the phonetic 癹, yielding a phono-semantic compound (semantic: 弓 ‘bow’ + phonetic: 癹).
etymology.interpretation: Begins as a drawing of a bow launching an arrow, capturing the idea of sending forth. Over time a hand element was added and then simplified into the sound-bearing 癹, while 弓 kept the sense of projecting or launching, aligning with meanings like “to send out” and “to issue.”
etymology.simplification: PRC 1956 scheme reduced 發/髮 to 发 by adopting an abbreviated form of the right-side component (癹 → 发) and dropping complex parts like 弓/髟, merging two traditional characters into one simpler graph.

examples.chinese: 我给你发短信(我給你發短信)。
examples.english: I’ll send you a text message.

examples.chinese: 星星在夜里发光(星星在夜裡發光)。
公司正在快速发展(公司正在快速發展)。
